isis.stitle: VT 275 Engine Service Manual - Fuel System - Removal and Disassembly - Horizontal Fuel Conditioning Module (HFCM)

svcproc.title: Horizontal Fuel Conditioning Module (HFCM)
svcproc.para: The HFCM is mounted in different locations for the CF and stripped chassis applications.
The CF application has the HFCM mounted on the vehicle frame rail on the driver's side.
The stripped chassis application has the HFCM mounted on a bracket attached to the transmission housing on the passenger side.
For both applications, see "Horizontal Fuel Conditioning Module (HFCM)" when doing the following steps:

step1.para: Place a container under HFCM to drain fuel and any accumulated water. Rotate drain knob to release fuel pressure and drain module.
Disconnect fuel pump, fuel heater, and water-in-fuel electrical connectors.
Press in retaining clips to release fuel hoses from housing.
Disconnect fuel hoses and discard fuel hose retaining clips
Remove three mounting nuts (M8) and fuel conditioning module from chassis.
